original:
Chilean Surrealism is a significant movement within the broader context of surrealism, characterized by its unique contributions from Chilean artists. One of the most prominent figures in this movement is Roberto Matta, whose work gained international acclaim and helped to elevate the profile of Chilean surrealism on the global stage.

In 2005, the exposition titled "Derrame Cono Sur o el viaje de los argonautas" showcased notable surre
